FestivalPlanner.GUI.SimulatorGUI

Class SimulatorCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • FestivalPlanner.GUI.AbstractGUI
      • FestivalPlanner.GUI.SimulatorGUI.SimulatorCanvas

  • public class SimulatorCanvas
extends AbstractGUI
    Contains methods to draw a TileMap to a canvas.

                SimulatorModule simulatorModule,
                double canvasWidth,
                double canvasHeight)
        Constructor for SimulatorCanvas
        Parameters:
        simulatorHandler - the class responsible for the logic of the simulator
        simulatorModule - the SimulatorModule that contains this canvas
        canvasWidth - the initial width of the canvas
        canvasHeight - the initial height of this canvas

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGUI
        Runs initialisation methods and sets general stage settings, then runs the show() or showAndWait() method.

        These include, but are not limited to:

        • setScene(Scene value)
        • setTitle(String value)
        • setWidth(Double value)
        • setResizable(boolean value)
        • initModality(Modality value)
        Specified by:
        load in class AbstractGUI

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGUI
        Sets the values, alignment and spacing and children on initialisation. Finally, the method setups the main layout, rarely anything else than a GridPane.

        All the values that will be set here belong to one of the following:

        • Initialising Values (For example: Setting the items of a combobox to a list)
        • Alignment and Spacing
        • Tooltips
        • Adding the children (Setting contents of HBox-s etc.)
        • Adding it all together (Adding everything to a pane)
        Specified by:
        setup in class AbstractGUI

      • actionHandlingSetup

        public void actionHandlingSetup()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGUI
        Sets EventHandling of JavaFX Nodes. Mostly setOnActions for Buttons.
        Specified by:
        actionHandlingSetup in class AbstractGUI

        public void update(java.lang.Double deltaTime)

        Parameters:

      • onWASD

        private void onWASD(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
        Handles the event of a keyboard key pressed by the user.

        When WASD or Arrow-keys are pressed the method will move the screen in the corresponding direction.

        Parameters:
        keyEvent - the KeyEvent that detected the users keyboardpress

      • onMousePressed

        private void onMousePressed(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
        Handles the event when the user presses the mouse-button

        If the primary button is pressed this.dragPoint will be set to the position the mouse has at that time.

        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - the MouseEvent the user used to click

      • onMouseReleased

        private void onMouseReleased(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
        Handles the event when the user releases the mouse-button

        If the primary button is released this.dragPoint will be reset to null.

        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - the MouseEvent the user used to click

      • onMouseDragged

        private void onMouseDragged(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
        Handles the event when the user drags the mouse-button across the screen

        If correct the screen will be moved to the new position. When done this.dragPoint will be reset to null.

        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - the MouseEvent the user used to drag

      • moveToPoint

        void moveToPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D point)
        Moves the screen to the centre of the proposed point.
        Parameters:
        point - the proposed point to move to

      • getCanvasPoint

        private java.awt.geom.Point2D getCanvasPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D point2D)
        Given a point on the screen this method wil return the coördinates that that point represents.

        The given point wil be moved based on the current panning and zoom, stored in this.cameraTransform.

        Parameters:
        point2D - the position on the screen that needs to be transformed
        Returns:
        the point on the field that the given point represents
